required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ASsessment of Adherence TO Medication in AtRIAl Fibrillation - an eMonitoring Drug Dispensing Device Study
clinical_study.official_title: ASsessment of Adherence TO Medication in AtRIAl Fibrillation - an eMonitoring Drug Dispensing Device Study

brief_summary.textblock: The ASTORIA study is a prospective cohort single-armed multicenter observational study that aims to assess adherence to rivaroxaban using a high technological electronical pillbox connected to a phone application in a group of atrial fibrillation patients with indication of long term anticoagulation treatment in routine clinical practice.

primary_outcome.description: The rate of adherence to rivaroxaban in a group of atrial fibrillation patients using the Pilloxa box will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.description: Rate of persistence to rivaroxaban in a group of atrial fibrillation patients using the Pilloxa box will be assessed
Risk factors for non-adherence and non-persistence in these patients will be evaluated
Patient experiences with the Pilloxa box and application will be evaluated using questionnaires and quality intervjues

arm_group.description: Patients receiving the Pilloxa pillbox for drug administration

intervention.description: Adherence to medication using an electronic pillbox

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female or male patient with age > 18 years
- Patients with atrial fibrillation
- Patients initiated, continued on or switched to rivaroxaban for the indication atrial fibrillation with intended lifelong treatment (CHA2 DS2-VASc score â‰¥ 1).
- The patient must agree to the use of the electronic medication adherence monitoring device, the so-called Pilloxa box and need to have a sufficient understanding of the app and functionality in conjunction with the use of the Pilloxa box.
- Signed informed consent
- No participation in an investigational program with interventions outside of routine clinical practice
- No contra-indications according to the local marketing authorization
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participation in an investigational program with interventions outside of routine clinical practice
- Contra-indications according to the local marketing authorization

overall_official.affiliation: Univerity of Oslo, Oslo University Hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: We do not plan to share IPD.
